Dan Petit
Director of DevOps at ServiceMaster
December 28, 2009, Kris reported directly to Dan

Dan is by far one of the best managers I've worked with.   He has both the technical knowledge and the ability to motivate a team that I believe it takes to see a project through.  He knows how to identify a teams strengths and weaknesses and utilize the talents where they are best suited, while getting the developers weakness paired with the strength of another team member on related tasks.  In doing so, he gets his people cross-trained and up to speed,  as well makes sure everyone is well rounded.He is fair and level handed in resolving issues that come up within the workplace and has a history of exceptional problem solving when extraordinary situations come up.  He's more than willing to work with individuals when problems arise and will go out of his way to help accommodate his employees if it's possible.

summary: Kris is a seasoned application and web developer whose 20+ year career in software development has been defined by helping small to medium-sized businesses grow and thrive through quality software offerings.  Kris has helped grow and to mature software development teams through new processes and procedures; such as introducing test driven development, paired programming, and agile development processes. Aside from his acumen with software development, Kris has led several small development teams ranging from three to twelve developers, DBAs, and other technical staff. Kris is known for his ability to judge his teams' strengths and weaknesses, helping him build up his team in the best manner possible while also cross-training team members to help grow their skills. Kris leads by example and ensures there is open communication with his team at all times, creating a more collaborative team atmosphere.Kris also has experience beyond the standard developer tricks, including graphics design work and digital audio processing. He knows his way around Photoshop fairly well and enjoys the graphics side of the house almost as much as software development, though he knows when to leave the work to the real pros.Specialties:  C#, .Net, ASP.Net, XML, SDLC, Agile, SCRUM, Software Development, Enterprise Architecture, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Business Analysis, Visual Studio, Web Services, Javascript, SharePoint, IIS, Database Design, Web Applications, WCF, VB.Net, jQuery, HTML, SOA, SaaS, Objective-C, Access, Classic ASP
